descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: ????? ??????????! Welcome back to Intermediate Russian! Intermediate Russian 102-2 is the second part in a three-quarter sequence designed to continue working on the Russian language and contemporary Russian culture. In this course, students will continue to develop the skills of speaking, listening, writing, and reading through a variety of communicative and content-based activities. Emphasis will be placed on practical communication so that students should be able to function in many authentic situations at an intermediate level by the end of the year.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite is 102-1 or consent of the Director of Slavic Languages, Professor Elisabeth Elliott (eelliott@northwestern.edu)

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Group work, brief lectures, drills, projects, readings, and discussions.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Quizzes, unit tests, final exam, regular homework, participation and attendance.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Russian Stage One: Live from Russia, vol. 2 Kendall/Hunt 2008. Textbook, Workbook, DVD, CD.

Stage Two: Welcome Back (3rd edition) Textbook and Workbook, DVD, CD, published by Kendall/Hunt
